one target capability unit of the requirement's link or null if there is no requirement or it has not link.

getAllHosts

public static java.util.List<Unit> getAllHosts(Unit unit)
Returns all the most realized hosts of the unit in the topology and its imported topologies.

See getAllHosts(Unit, boolean) for description of algorithm.

Parameters:
unit - the hosted unit
considerGroups - flag to determine if one should consider group membership as a criterion for host
Returns:
List of all hosts (never null).

getAllHosts

public static java.util.List<Unit> getAllHosts(Unit unit,
                                               boolean considerGroups)
Returns all the most realized hosts of the unit in the topology and its imported topologies.

Does not perform discovery (matcher safe).

    Algorithm:
  • Consults the hosting links unit as well as all its realization linked units (RealizationLinkUtil.getAllRealizationLinkedObjects(DeployModelObject).
  • For each host, it identifies the most realized unit (RealizationLinkUtil.getFinalRealization(DeployModelObject).

Parameters:
unit - the hosted unit
considerGroups - flag to determine if one should consider group membership as a criterion for host
Returns:
List list of all hosters (never null).

getNonConceptualUnit

public static Unit getNonConceptualUnit(Unit unit)
Returns the first non-conceptual unit which realizes the conceptual unit argument.

Follows the realization link chain until a non-conceptual unit is found. Detects realization cycles, and returns null.

Parameters:
unit - a conceptual unit.
Returns:
the non-conceptual unit by which this unit is directly, or indirectly realized.

getImmediateHost

public static Unit getImmediateHost(Unit unit)
Returns the immediate host of the unit in the topology and its imported topologies.

Unlike getHost(Unit) which navigates the unit's and its host realization links to find the most realized unit, this method returns the immediate host of the unit, independent of whether it is conceptual or not.

Parameters:
unit - a hosted topology unit.
Returns:
the immediate host unit, or null if it does not exist or is ambigious.
See Also:
getHost(Unit)

getImmediateHost

public static Unit getImmediateHost(Unit unit,
                                    boolean considerGroups)
Returns the immediate host of the unit in the topology and its imported topologies.

Unlike getHost(Unit) which navigates the unit's and its host realization links to find the most realized unit, this method returns the immediate host of the unit, independent of whether it is conceptual or not.

Parameters:
unit - a hosted topology unit.
considerGroups - flag to determine if one should consider group membership as a criterion for host
Returns:
the immediate host unit, or null if it does not exist or is ambigious.
See Also:
getHost(Unit, boolean)

public static java.util.List<Unit> getImmediateHosted(Unit host)

Does not perform discovery. Validators should use #discoverHosted(Unit, EClass).

host - the host unit.
Returns:
List of units hosted directly (may include conceptual units).
See Also:
getHosted(Unit, EClass)

getImmediateHosted

                                                      EClass type)

Does not perform discovery. Validators should use #discoverHosted(Unit, EClass).

Parameters:
host - the host unit.
type - an optional unit or capability type used to filter the list of hosted units returned (null means any).
Returns:
List of units hosted directly (may include conceptual units).
See Also:
getHosted(Unit, EClass)

getImmediateDependencyLinkTarget

public static Capability getImmediateDependencyLinkTarget(Requirement req)
Returns the immediate target of the dependency link.

Dependency links on requirements in the edit topology are contained by the requirement, and on imported topologies may be contained in the topology or on the requirement.

Because dependency links can be contained in the topology, it is possible to have multiple dependency links from a requirement. This is not semantically valid.

Parameters:
req - a topology requirement.
Returns:
the capability linked to the requirement, or null if none or ambigious.

getImmediateDependencyLinkTargets

public static java.util.List<Capability> getImmediateDependencyLinkTargets(Requirement req)
Returns the list of dependency link capability targets whose immediate source is the requirement.

Parameters:
req - a topology requirement.
Returns:
List

Returns a list of requirements that immediately depend on the capability.

Parameters:
cap - a topology capability.
Returns:
List that are sources to dependency links whose target is the capability.

getImmediateGroups

public static java.util.List<Unit> getImmediateGroups(Unit member)

This methods will return all units that group a unit independent of the group unit type (see getImmediateGroups(Unit, Requirement)).

Parameters:
member - the topology unit.
Returns:
List of units that are sources to hosting links targeting the member.

This methods will return all units that group a unit independent of the group unit type (see #getImmediateMembers(Unit, Requirement)).

Parameters:
group - the topology unit.
Returns:
List of units that are targets to hosting links whose source is the group.

discoverDependencyLinkTarget

public static Capability discoverDependencyLinkTarget(Requirement req,
                                                      Topology top,
                                                      boolean relaxedDmoType,
                                                      IProgressMonitor monitor)
Discovers the target of the requirement's dependency link.

Parameters:
req - a unit requirement.
top - typically the edit topology
relaxedDmoType - if false: discover target that is an instance of req.dmoType if true: discover target that may not only be an instance of req.dmoType, but possibly also a supertype of req.dmoType.
Returns:
the capability that the requirement targets, or null if not found.

isParameter

public static boolean isParameter(DeployModelObject object,
                                  java.lang.String attribute)
Returns true if the parameter identifies a parameter in the object.

Parameters are currently identified by two model mechanisms, both of which are checked:

  • AttributeMetaData.isParameter()
  • Agreement.isPublicEditable(DeployModelObject)

Parameters:
object - a deploy attribute object.
attribute - the full or relative attribute name.
Returns:
true if it is defined as a parameter in the instance.

true if the unit of the object can be found and has a goal state of "not installed", false otherwise.
